metadata.title: CVE-2024-42286 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:scsi: qla2xxx: validate nvme_local_port correctlyThe driver load failed with error message,qla2xxx [0000:04:00.0]-ffff:0: register_localport failed: ret=ffffffefand with a kernel crash,	BUG: unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference at 0000000000000070	Workqueue: events_unbound qla_register_fcport_fn [qla2xxx]	RIP: 0010:nvme_fc_register_remoteport+0x16/0x430 [nvme_fc]	RSP: 0018:ffffaaa040eb3d98 EFLAGS: 00010282	RAX: 0000000000000000 RBX: ffff9dfb46b78c00 RCX: 0000000000000000	RDX: ffff9dfb46b78da8 RSI: ffffaaa040eb3e08 RDI: 0000000000000000	RBP: ffff9dfb612a0a58 R08: ffffffffaf1d6270 R09: 3a34303a30303030	R10: 34303a303030305b R11: 2078787832616c71 R12: ffff9dfb46b78dd4	R13: ffff9dfb46b78c24 R14: ffff9dfb41525300 R15: ffff9dfb46b78da8	FS:  0000000000000000(0000) GS:ffff9dfc67c00000(0000)knlGS:0000000000000000	CS:  0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033	CR2: 0000000000000070 CR3: 000000018da10004 CR4: 00000000000206f0	Call Trace:	qla_nvme_register_remote+0xeb/0x1f0 [qla2xxx]	? qla2x00_dfs_create_rport+0x231/0x270 [qla2xxx]	qla2x00_update_fcport+0x2a1/0x3c0 [qla2xxx]	qla_register_fcport_fn+0x54/0xc0 [qla2xxx]Exit the qla_nvme_register_remote() function when qla_nvme_register_hba()fails and correctly validate nvme_local_port.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-generic - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-lowlatency - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1139-gcp - 5.4.0-1139.148~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1082-ibm - 5.4.0-1082.87~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
